list_definition.definition: to push (something sharp or pointed) into or through something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She stuck a pin through the papers to hold them together
Stop sticking your elbow into me!

list_definition.definition: (of something pointed) to be pushed into or through something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Two arrows were sticking in his back.

list_definition.definition: to fasten or be fastened (by glue, gum etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He licked the flap of the envelope and stuck it down
These labels don’t stick very well
He stuck (the broken pieces of) the vase together again
His brothers used to call him Bonzo and the name has stuck.

list_definition.mean_english: làm sa lầy, làm vướng mắc
list_definition.definition: to (cause to) become fixed and unable to move or progress

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The car stuck in the mud
I’ll help you with your arithmetic if you’re stuck.

list_definition.definition: a branch or twig from a tree

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They were sent to find sticks for firewood.

list_definition.definition: a long thin piece of wood etc shaped for a special purpose

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She always walks with a stick nowadays

list_ex_of_english: The aggregates are formed by the release of the adhesive post-acetabular gland secretion which causes the cercariae to stick together.
If one decides to stick, strictly, to the established principles of medical ethics, one possible position is to regard medicine as a pacifist profession.
Several carried sticks, but they were otherwise unarmed, and the state representative says nothing about actually being touched by anyone.
Life adapted to an atmosphere is stuck on the planet where it started.
A stiff estimation of the parameters assists the control system to avoid the stick-slip phenomenon.
The older generation of writers was, more or less, politically driven and just got stuck as the politics crashed.
For simplicity, we stick with this particular application.
The third category is at first sight more random - wooden sticks, walls, pots, ingots, spindlewhorls.
